Issues.Title: ivy-ngcc is unable to recognise AngularFireModule.initializeApp as ModuleWithProviders
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/compiler-cli` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Take a look at this code (taken from https://unpkg.com/@angular/fire@5.1.1/es2015/firebase.app.module.js): ```typescript let AngularFireModule = AngularFireModule_1 = class AngularFireModule { static initializeApp(options, nameOrConfig) { return { ngModule: AngularFireModule_1, providers: [ { provide: FirebaseOptionsToken, useValue: options }, { provide: FirebaseNameOrConfigToken, useValue: nameOrConfig } ] }; } }; AngularFireModule = AngularFireModule_1 = __decorate([ NgModule({ providers: [FirebaseAppProvider], }) ], AngularFireModule); export { AngularFireModule }; ``` `ivy-ngcc` cannot recognise the `AngularFireModule.initializeApp` and mark it as `ModuleWithProviders`. This is because the current implementation of `ivy-ngcc` which looks for `ts.ClassDeclaration`. Instead, the code above is a variable assignment to `ts.BinaryExpression` which includes `ts.ClassExpression`. There are 2 solutions to this issue: 1. Make `ivy-ngcc` to able to recognise class declaration like this. 2. Tell library authors to use `angularCompilerOptions.annotationsAs` as `static fields` during packaging. My voice is with solution 2, though. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction N/A ## üî• Exception or Error N/A ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


8.0.0-beta.6
**Anything else relevant?** This causes #28603.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ivy-ngcc is unable to recognise AngularFireModule.initializeApp as ModuleWithProviders" (#29078)

Issues.Title: Service worker requestSubscription() freezes and doesn't show native popup if serviceworker.controller is null
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/service-worker ### Is this a regression? No ### Description The problem is here https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/a06824aef6e2e1c5b1c037d2c2e1dda544842000/packages/service-worker/src/low_level.ts#L74-L82 When `controllerchange` is triggered, the code access to `serviceworker.controller` and filters it if is `null`. After that, the `registration` is created from the previous pipes. What happens if the `serviceworker.controller` is `null` in all `controllerchange` events? (At the moment you are thinking that couldn't happen, but yes üéâit happens!!!üéâ. Then if the app is started with `serviceworker.controller = null `and `requestSubscription` is called a few minutes later, the promise won't never be resolved. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c0757d1d440d6f934436418add9755e7d630bbcf/packages/service-worker/src/push.ts#L93-L99 **Possible solution** Merging `registration`observable with `serviceworker.ready`but I'm not sure if breaks something. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c0757d1d440d6f934436418add9755e7d630bbcf/packages/service-worker/src/low_level.ts#L81-L82 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The problem reproduction is explained in the previous section. But if you want to get crazy to Chrome to test the bug, you can do the following: You can test this on Chrome 72 Windows, the steps are not going to work on Chrome Mac. But I have logs that prove the bug happens in other Chrome version and platforms, maybe, doing different steps, but the state is the same, `serviceworker.controller` is `null`. Steps Chrome Windows. 1. Create a app with a checkbox or switch button to activate/descativate notifications. 2. Check the switch in your app will call `requestSubscription()` 3. When the popup is shown, press Block. 4. Go to de addressbar, click in the lock :lock:. Change the notifications state to Allow. Chrome will say you that the page should be reloaded. 6. Reload the page. 7. If you call `requestSubscription()`again, you won't get the popup. Or if you write in the console `serviceworker.controller` you will get `null`. Here is an example image. The app is started, `serviceworker.controller` is `null`, but I can get the service worker registration and the push subscription, so `serviceworker.controller` is not needed to get it. (Keys are hidden in the image). ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** Tested in angular 7.1.7 but I think all version are affected. **Anything else relevant?** I use this code with a timeout before I run into the issue to avoid freezing the function. I'm getting logs `Can`t subscribe: Timeout ocurred `from Chrome Windows but specially lots of entries for Chrome android. ```typescript this.swPush.requestSubscription({serverPublicKey: this.VAPID_PUBLIC_KEY})) .pipe( timeout(8000), tap({ next: () => this.measuringDao.sendBackendEvent('activated_notifications').subscribe(), error: err => this.logger.warn('Can\'t subscribe: ' + err.toString(), err) }), switchMap(sub => this.notificationsDao.registerPushSubscriber(sub)) ); ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Service worker requestSubscription() freezes and doesn't show native popup if serviceworker.controller is null" (#29067)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): attached flag not being reset when view is destroyed
Issues.Body:
Currently we only reset the `Attached` flag of a view if it is detached through its parent, however this means that if a root view is destroyed, its flag will never be reset. This manifested itself in one of the Material tests where we were destroying the root view.

This PR resolves FW-1130.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): attached flag not being reset when view is destroyed" (#29064)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): correctly evaluate enum references in template expressions
Issues.Body:
The ngtsc partial evaluator previously would not handle an enum reference
inside a template string expression correctly. Enums are resolved to an
`EnumValue` type, which has a `resolved` property with the actual value.

When effectively toString-ing a `ResolvedValue` as part of visiting a
template expression, the partial evaluator needs to translate `EnumValue`s
to their fully resolved value, which this commit does.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): correctly evaluate enum references in template expressions" (#29062)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): copy top-level comments into generated factory shims
Issues.Body:
When ngtsc generates a .ngfactory shim, it does so based on the contents of
an original file in the program. Occasionally these original files have
comments at the top which are load-bearing (e.g. they contain jsdoc
annotations which are significant to downstream bundling tools). The
generated factory shims should preserve this comment.

This commit adds a step to the ngfactory generator to preserve the top-level
comment from the original source file.

FW-1006 #resolve
FW-1095 #resolve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): copy top-level comments into generated factory shims" (#29065)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): use the imported name of decorators for detection
Issues.Body:
Currently, ngtsc has a bug where if you alias the name of a decorator when
importing it, it won't be detected properly. This is because the compiler
uses the aliased name and not the original, declared name of the decorator
for detection.

This commit fixes the compiler to compare against the declared name of
decorators when available, and adds a test to prevent regression.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): use the imported name of decorators for detection" (#29061)

Issues.Title: Angular Elements input is not defined on Init
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/elements ### Is this a regression? I'm not sure ### Description Passing a function into angular custom element, the input/component life cycle is different from normal angular component, causing some problems with apps dependent on the Input function at init. I think the function passed down is not available at "OnInit" phase for the web element but it's available for the Angular component Following the provided stackblitz, only the web element throws the error. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/is-not-a-function ## üî• Exception or Error preview-ee4d58d6ef0576b4e139b.js:1 TypeError: _co.getString is not a function at Object.eval [as updateRenderer] (HeartComponent.html:8) at Object.debugUpdateRenderer [as updateRenderer] (services.ts:408) at checkAndUpdateView (view.ts:368) at callViewAction (view.ts:615) at execComponentViewsAction (view.ts:559) at checkAndUpdateView (view.ts:370) at callWithDebugContext (services.ts:639) at Object.debugCheckAndUpdateView [as checkAndUpdateView] (services.ts:345) at ViewRef_.detectChanges (refs.ts:259) at ComponentNgElementStrategy.detectChanges (component-factory-strategy.ts:251) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**
@angular/common6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/compiler6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/core6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/elements6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/forms6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/platform-browser6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/platform-browser-dynamic6.0.0-rc.4 @angular/router6.0.0-rc.4 @webcomponents/custom-elements1.1.0 core-js2.5.4 rxjs6.0.0-rc.0 zone.js **Anything else relevant?** On my main project, using Angular V6.0.3, I experience the same behaviour...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Elements input is not defined on Init" (#29050)

Issues.Title: ngFor memory leak
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Is this a regression?
Don't think so.

### Description

Structure: `AppComponent` , `OneComponent`, `TwoComponent`, `TestService`

`OneComponent` and `TwoComponent` are displayed in `AppComponent` _(only one component is displayed at the same time -> i added button to switch between those components)._

`OneComponent` and `TwoComponent` contains a TemplateRef, when `OneComponent` or `TwoComponent` is created this TemplateRef is added to a `TestService` which is provided by the `AppComponent`.
If `OneComponent` or `TwoComponent` gets destroyed the will remove their TemplateRef from the `TestService`.

TestService: adding / removing a TemplateRef will add remove it to a behaviorSubject (included in TestService).

The `AppComponent` will bind to this behaviorSubject  async.  and display the TemplateRefs.

I added 4 test cases inside the `AppComponent` - template: (just (un)comment to test this test cases)

- Test1 (memory leak):  _ngFor binding with async pipe and displaying the templateRef in templateOutlet_
- Test 2 (memory leak): _ngFor binding an empty ng-container with async pipe, do not display anything_
- Test 3 (no memory leak): _ngIf binding the first element with async pipe, display the templateRef in templateOutlet_
- Test 4 (no memory leak): _binding the first element with async pipe directly to templateOutlet_

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-grux6a

_*this is just a quick implementation to reproduce this "bug", no error checks not a clean code but that was not the point*_

## üî• Exception or Error

Using the browser memory tool (snapshots) shows for Test1 and Test2 that `OneComponent` and `TwoComponent` are still in memory even if they are not displayed.

Expected: `OneComponent` should not be in memory when `TwoComponent` is displayed and vice versa.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
7.2.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngFor memory leak" (#29053)

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [X] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
TypeScript compiler has been great so far, but showed some limitations especially when it comes to transpiling ES6 third party modules to ES5. This can be a pretty big issue when developers have requirements with older browsers, or simply want (or need) their website to pass the Google Crawler without any issue, such as "**Unexpected token "=>"**". This issue is also showing on older browsers.

### Describe the solution you'd like
This is a problem that can be solved by using babel to transpile ES6 module to ES5, and @babel/preset-typescript to transpile TypeScript to ES5 as well.

Thanks!

Issues.Title: Angular is installed in two different places on Mac and calling the out of date version
Issues.Body:
Hi there,

I created a folder on my users's directory to install all npm packages (I have for example, Ionic 4 installed there).

Then I installed Angular Cli 7 and it went to the correct location in: 
`~/.npm-packages/lib/node_modules/@angular/cli/bin`

When I type: `ng --version` I see the version of the one installed in `/usr/local/bin/ng` which is **1.6.0**

I had to put on my `~/.bash_profile` this:
`export PATH=~/.npm-packages/lib/node_modules/@angular/cli/bin:$PATH`

Then every time I start the computer I have to run on the terminal:
`source ~/.bash_profile`

Otherwise it keeps doing everything with that old version.

I would like to remove that old installation and keep only this one inside `.npm-packages`, how can I do that

Thank you!

### Description

Is it possible that cli would check if server is running?

Issues.Title: Importing Locally Build Library Inside Another Library Angular v 6
Issues.Body:
While Trying to Import Library Into Another Library I get an Error Cannot Find Module where as the Library is there and Build in Dist Folder.

I have Build 1 Library Say Lib1 it is complied properly using ng build lib1.

When i try to Import any file from Lib1 into Lib2 i am getting error cannot Find Module ..

How to reproduce.

Build a Library 1 and then export all the Files of that Lib 1 that are to be exposed into the public_api.ts .

Add the Lib 1 as dep into Lib2 by adding it into tsconfig.lib.json file .

```
  "compilerOptions": {
    ......
    "paths":{
      "lib1": [
        "dist/lib1"
      ]
    }
  },

```

Add the Deps into Module of Lib2 and components where you want to use it . And build the library you will get the following error.

> Cannot find module 'lib1'.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Importing Locally Build Library Inside Another Library Angular v 6" (#13786)

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): change layout of e2e files
Issues.Body:
With this change E2E files will be relocated inside an existing application instead of creating a seperate E2E project. This will also remove a lot of extra boilerplating inside the workspace configuration file.

File layout:
```
‚îÇ   browserslist
‚îÇ   karma.conf.js
‚îÇ   tsconfig.app.json
‚îÇ   tsconfig.spec.json
‚îÇ   tslint.json
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄe2e
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   protractor.conf.js
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   tsconfig.e2e.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄsrc
‚îÇ           app.e2e-spec.ts
‚îÇ           app.po.ts
‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄsrc
    ‚îÇ   favicon.ico
    ‚îÇ   index.html
    ‚îÇ   main.po.ts
    ‚îÇ   main.ts
    ‚îÇ   polyfills.ts
    ‚îÇ   styles.css
    ‚îÇ   test.ts
    ‚îÇ
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄapp
    ‚îÇ       app.component.css
    ‚îÇ       app.component.html
    ‚îÇ       app.component.spec.ts
    ‚îÇ       app.component.ts
    ‚îÇ       app.module.ts
    ‚îÇ
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄassets
    ‚îÇ       .gitkeep
    ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄenvironments
            environment.prod.ts
            environment.ts
```

Ref: TOOL-699

Closes #12326
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@schematics/angular): change layout of e2e files" (#13780)

Issues.Title: fix(checkbox): clear name from host node
Issues.Body: Currently we forward the name attribute from the host node to the underlying input, however we leave the name on the host node intact. This can throw off functions like `document.getElementsByName` or the `By.name` Protractor selector.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(checkbox): clear name from host node" (#15368)

Issues.Title: refactor(autocomplete): rework cases not using document token

Issues.Title: CDK Drag & Drop item doesn't scroll page/container
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Moving and dragging the item at window top or bottom bounds will scroll in that direction.

#### What is the current behavior?
It doesn't scroll window/container.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/angular/kelvlyydgmb
Try to pick an item from end of the list and bring it to first position. Page wont scroll up (without using mouse wheel)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Latest versions

#### Is there anything else we should know?
No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CDK Drag & Drop item doesn't scroll page/container" (#15365)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): alt + up arrow to close panel not working
Issues.Body: Currently we support the part of the spec where the autocomplete panel is supposed to close when pressing alt + up arrow, however at some point we added more functionality that ends up reopening the panel immediately. These changes ensure that the user is able to close the panel via alt + up arrow.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): alt + up arrow to close panel not working" (#15364)

Issues.Title: Layout of docs page is broken
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Docs page text to be responsive, adjusting to the width of the browser window.

#### What is the current behavior?
Text is overflowing the browser window and no horizontal scrollbar is visible.
When viewing that page on an iPad it won't let you scroll down.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Go to [https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview](https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview) and resize your browser window. Or open that page on an iPad.
![untitled-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5860703/53680747-f35f6680-3cdf-11e9-83fc-95e6392ef09b.jpg)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Layout of docs page is broken" (#15363)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): use narrow value for aria-haspopup
Issues.Body: [Based on the spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#aria-haspopup), `aria-haspopup` can be set to indicate what kind of popup the element has. These changes update the autocomplete one to show that it opens a listbox.

Issues.Title: mat menu not working correctly when two triggers are used for same mat-menu
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
I am using mat menu without backdrop. 
I am trying to open mat-menu with two different triggers
When we click on triggers it should close and open mat menu correctly.

#### What is the current behavior?
1. When I click on first trigger button it opens mat menu 
2. When I click on second trigger it opens mat-menu
3. When I again click on first trigger it doesn't open mat-menu
4. Again if click on first trigger then it will open mat-menu


#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Have a look on below stackblitz
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-yvk7bv 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular 7+

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I checked in DOM when I click on first trigger button it adds div with class `cdk-overlay-connected-position-bounding-box`, when I click on second trigger again it adds one more div with same class.

It seems it is not destroying properly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat menu not working correctly when two triggers are used for same mat-menu" (#15354)

Issues.Body:
This PR does two things:

1) Fixes a minor issue in `CdkVirtualScroll` where sometimes views were inserted twice.

2) Fixes some tests that were relying on the fact that an externally requested `ViewContainerRef` would be the same instance as the injected `ViewContainerRef` instance (specifically `spyOn` methods were spying on a different instance). This is an implementation detail that is changed in Ivy.  Also fixes these tests so that they aren't spying directly on `ViewContainerRef` method calls (as these are also called internally by `ViewContainerRef` itself and could change at any time).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(virtual-scroll): move views that are already attached instead of inserting" (#15348)

Issues.Title: fix(virtual-scroll): move views that are already attached instead of inserting
Issues.Body:
This PR does three things:

1) Marks a query as static in `CdkVirtualScrollViewport`

2) Fixes some tests that were relying on the fact that an externally requested `ViewContainerRef` would be the same instance as the injected `ViewContainerRef` instance (specifically `spyOn` methods were spying on a different instance). This is an implementation detail that is changed in Ivy.  Also fixes these tests so that they aren't spying directly on `ViewContainerRef` method calls (as these are also called internally by `ViewContainerRef` itself and could change at any time).

3) Fixes a minor issue in `CdkVirtualScroll` where sometimes views were inserted twice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(virtual-scroll): move views that are already attached instead of inserting" (#15345)

Issues.Title: fix(chips): focus lost if last chip is deleted
Issues.Body:
Fixes the user's focus being lost if they delete the last chip in a list.

Fixes #15338.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(chips): focus lost if last chip is deleted" (#15344)

Issues.Title: Drag and drop does not work correctly when change data while dragging
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When change data while dragging, for example when have lazy load of items. D&d should update `siblings` and `draggables`

#### What is the current behavior?
current just ignore, cuz copy data before drag
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/directives/drop-list.ts#L322
https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drop-list-ref.ts#L179
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag and drop does not work correctly when change data while dragging" (#15343)

Issues.Title: Add a way to mat accordion to have a title row before the expansion panes
Issues.Body: #### Please describe the feature you would like to request. It would be great to be able to have something like the picture. Sometimes we want to add accordions to a specific section, and even tho accomplish it with a mat-card and some css is possible, it requires some extra work. Having `mat-accordion-header` and `mat-accordion-title` would be nice. #### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal? Want to divide the accordions into sections, which is a really common use case. #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add a way to mat accordion to have a title row before the expansion panes" (#15342)
